rounds.category: OXFORD DICTIONARIES WORD OF THE YEAR

clues.text: This 2013 word was photogenic, at least for one person, alone
This Facebook way of saying goodbye to a pal forever was the hit of 2009
In 2005 this digital recording of a radio show beat out "lifehack" & "trans fat"
For 2007 the honor went to this word for one who eats food grown or produced nearby
In 2012 this 3-letter type of computer file of a video sequence was the word
This group's "Goats Head Soup" featured the acoustic ballad "Angie"
While cutting this album, Michael Jackson enlisted Vincent Price to provide a spoken word segment on the title track
Attention!  This 1991 U2 album was recorded in Berlin
Photographer Jim McCrary put Carole King's cat in the cover photo of this 1971 album
Tracks on this group's 1968 album "Waiting for the Sun" include "Love Street"
Verne drew from Edgar Allan Poe to write his first novel, "Five Weeks in" this aerial transport
This seagoing captain is described as "an Indian, the Prince Dakkar, son of a rajah"
Though his mind was up in the clouds, in 1857 Verne began an earthbound job as one of these securities agents
During her 72-day trip around the world, 1889-90, she stopped in Amiens to visit with Verne, who had inspired her trip
This novel features 3 space travelers who launch from near present-day Kennedy Space Center
Mia Wallace in "Pulp Fiction"
Barbara Weston in "August: Osage County"
Donnie Azoff in "The Wolf of Wall Street"
Matron Mama Morton in "Chicago "
Dr. Berger in "Ordinary People"
The Democratic HQ at the Watergate that the burglars broke into was busy supporting this eventual 1972 nominee
These 2 Washington Post Metro Desk reporters were assigned to cover the break-in
Of Nixon's attempts to claim executive this, Senator Sam Ervin said, "That is executive poppycock"
The scandal led to the resignations of top aides H.R. Haldeman & this ‑man, assistant to Nixon for domestic affairs
In 2014, when he was 75, this White House counsel put out a book with the tapes transcribed
In People's 1987 Best & Worst Dressed Survey, this dog took the best of breed in his classic yachting blazer
"Dress for Success" says one of these is the only completely acceptable ring for men to wear
Of navy, beige or black, color of a man's raincoat that "Dress for Success" says makes the best impression
An ornament that hangs from a watch chain, or the vest pocket in which to put a watch
This did not become an integral part of men's trousers until the 19th century
The name of this language in the language itself is Igpay Atinlay
According to legend, even vain vampires can't see these in their mirrors
Daniel Boone called this, his Boone companion, Ticklicker
Tropical fruit which tops the men's singles trophy awarded at Wimbledon
Most parts of the digestive system are included in this long "canal"
Before they mature, these deer appendages are covered with soft hair called velvet
From the age of three months to three years, these largest primates often ride piggyback
Warthogs are found naturally only on this continent
German for badger dog, this dog was bred for short legs so it could pull badgers from their burrows
Found primarily in the Amazon basin, the capybara or water hog is the largest animal of this order
It's the actual river referred to in the spiritual "Deep River"
"Oh, a-rocka my soul in" this person's bosom
"It was good for Paul & Silas & it's good enough for me"
Black spiritual from the days of slavery that some Jewish people now associate with passover
"So I'll cherish" it "till my trophies at last I lay down...& exchange it some day for a crown"
Whether flavored with strawberry, peach or banana, a margarita always contains this
In astronomy her name refers to a constellation and in the movie to a strain of virus
Three Rivers, Riverfront, Busch & Yankee
While many a Roman emperor declared himself to be a god, this one, it's said, claimed to be all the gods
1 of the tribes of the Iroquois whose name ends with "a"
In "An Occurence at Owl Creek Bridge" the occurence is this tragic event
"The Kugelmass Episode" is a story by this clarinet-playing Academy Award-winning director
Tessie Hutchinson is the fatally unlucky winner of this contest in a Shirley Jackson story
Business establishment referred to in the Hemingway title, "A Clean, Well-Lighted Place"
"With that faint, fleeting smile playing about his lips, he faced the firing squad", according to Thurber
This Southeast Asian country has been ruled by the Mac, Tran, & Ngo dynasties
Deriving their name from Welsh for "Theodore" they ruled England from 1485-1603
The Oldenburg lineage includes the Duke of Edinburgh & the rulers of these 2 Scandinavian nations
It was the title used by Mongol rulers of the Yuan dynasty in China, not their last name
Russia grew vastly in size & power under this house that succeeded the Riurukid dynasty in the 17th cent.

rounds.text: This American general born in 1820 was called "Cump" by his siblings
